text: I'm drew pinsky and today I'm going to
introduce you to the wild world of
Bangkok's traffic Bangkok Thailand a
city that's known for its Buddhist
temples night markets as you can see
behind me it's really crowded there's
lots of people here shopping malls and
street food but also a city that's
overpopulated chaotic and congested
containing some of the world's worst
traffic 24 hours a day seven days a week
the main roads of Bangkok are slammed
with traffic jams gridlock streets of
buses cars kick jokes motorbikes
bicycles and pedestrians all battling
their way to scoop buy a new study by
the World Health Organization ranked
Thailand as the world's second deadliest
country in death rates by road accidents
alone why is traffic so extreme in
Bangkok a large part of this mess is
because drivers do not follow the rules
they cut people off switch lanes
unexpectedly talk on their phones run
red lights and blatantly block
intersections many of these flagrant
drivers are on motorbikes five people on
a bike which might explain for so many
deaths there seems to be as many
motorbikes as cars on the road zooming
through kilometers of long queues
whenever you see a motorbike driver
wearing an orange vest he's a taxi
driver who will take you anywhere for
cheap but they almost never give you
helmets and it's like the world's
scariest roller coaster to ride on one
and when they're cutting through these
cars it's really dangerous because if a
car opened their door they're gonna
whack you on the positive side
Bangkok's crazy roads can be avoided by
either taking the overground BTS or
underground MRT system but if you think
rush hour only exists on the streets
then think again
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world it's electric it's sexy its
tasty it's confusing but above all its
futuristic the Japanese are innovators
they somehow
